content: time row 10 - cluster stitch row 2 ch2 does not count as a st cluster st in each chain space around join with slip_stitch to top of beg ch2 changing back to contrast colour at the same time row 11 - chain1 and double_crochet into same chain as slip_stitch *ch1 double_crochet in next chain space repeat from * around finish with slip_stitch into first double_crochet changing to main cluster colour at the same time repeat row 10-11 a total of 5 times more to create a band of 6 cluster stitch rounds cut yarn row 22 - join new yarn with a standing treble_crochet then treble_crochet in each stitch around join with slip_stitch to first treble_crochet to close round row 23-26 treble_crochet in each st around row 27 - ch2 counts as 1 double_crochet then double_crochet in each st around cut yarn sleeves make both alike row 1 - with contrast cluster colour join with standing double_crochet into first treble_crochet after underarm stitches *ch1 skip next st double_crochet in next st repeat from * around to last treble then ch1 double_crochet around the treble on the last round of yoke then for underarm stitches ch1 skip next st double_crochet in next space created by the first cluster round of body double_crochet around the treble on the last round of yoke working now on the opposite side of the sweater finish with slip_stitch into first double_crochet changing to main cluster colour at the same time 13 chain spaces row 2 - chain 2 cluster stitch in each space around join with slip_stitch to top of beg ch2 changing back to contrast colour at the same time 13 clusters row 3 - chain1 and double_crochet into same chain as slip_stitch *ch1 double_crochet in next chain space repeat from * around finish with slip_stitch into first double_crochet changing to main cluster colour at the same time repeat row 2-3 a total of 5 times more to create a band of 6 cluster stitch rounds cut yarn row 14 - join new yarn with a standing treble_crochet then treble_crochet in each stitch around join with slip_stitch to first treble_crochet to close round row 15-16 treble_crochet in each st around row 17 - ch2 counts as 1 double_crochet then double_crochet in each st around cut yarn make buttonhole loops and neck edges with rs facing attach chosen yarn with a standing double_crochet into first stitch at the bottom of the back opening double_crochet 2 chain 4 double_crochet 2 ch4 then double_crochet ch1 double_crochet into corner stitch double_crochet in each stitch around neck and down opposite side of back opening cut yarn weave in all ends and attach two buttons to back opening matching position carefully with the buttonhole loops
